result.execSummary:
The defendant James W Berst was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of THC [Modifiers: as a Party to a Crime], an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: --On Count #1 the Court sentences the Defendant to pay a fine of $100 + costs + $62.50 in drug testing fees = $736.  The Court grants Mr. Berst sixty days to pay the amount in full or to establish a payment plan with the Clerk of Courts Office.  Non -payment shall result in a 20 day jail term, with Huber privileges consecutive.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

chargeModifiers.descr: as a Party to a Crime

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

chargeModifiers.descr: as a Party to a Crime

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. James W Berst

records.addlTxt:
[MK] case called at 3:02pm. 
Defendant James W Berst in court with Attorney Steven J Sarbacker.  ADA Brookellen Teuber appears for the State of Wisconsin.  
Maximum penalties recited; Constitutional rights given; plea of " No Contest  " entered on Count #1; factual basis stipulated; victim rights compliance verified; the Court accepts the plea, finds the Defendant guilty, and orders Judgment of Conviction entered.

On Motion of the State the Court reads-in and dismisses Count #2.  

On Count #1 the Court sentences the Defendant to pay a fine of $100 + costs + $62.50 in drug testing fees = $736.  The Court grants Mr. Berst sixty days to pay the amount in full or to establish a payment plan with the Clerk of Courts Office.  Non -payment shall result in a 20 day jail term, with Huber privileges consecutive.
The Court requires DNA sample provision.
recess 3:08pm.
Status conference on May 17, 2018 at 10:00 am.

Attorney Sarbacker requests a pretrial conference and Status date be scheduled.

Case called at 10:54 am [Clerk SH]
Defendant James W Berst in court with Attorney Steven James Sarbacker. DA Susan Victoria Happ appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
DA Happ confirms victim rights compliance; Court so finds
Atty Sarbacker informs the Court that Mr. Berst has been offered entry into FOP. He lives in IL, but has not yet been able to set up meeting. Thought may be able to pay fee and make appointment today. They are full today, but will pay fee and set appointment.
DA Happ informs the Court that it usually takes 2-3 weeks for entry process into FOP
Court informs parties that It will set matter for additional STC and if the Defendant is accepted into FOP, once the Court receives letter notice of acceptance, the STC can come off the calendar.

Status conference on June 21, 2016 at 10:30 am.

of Judge; the Court made finding on Record

Case called at 2:47pm [mo]
Defendant James W Berst in court with Attorney Steven James Sarbacker.   ADA Brookellen Teuber appears for the State of Wisconsin.
  
Defendant verifies that the date of birth and address listed on the Criminal Complaint are correct. 
Service of Complaint admitted, reading waived

Atty. Sarbacker submits a Request for Substitution
The Court finds it is in proper form, but not consistent with statute due to the Co-Defendant nature of the case
The Court does conclude that this is a multi defendant case; recites statute related 
The Court concludes that the request is not timely, gives basis

The Defendant stands mute; the Court enters not guilty plea on behalf of Mr. Berst
The Court finds probable cause to exist in the Criminal Complaint. 
Speedy trial waived by the Defendant

The Court requires $500  signature bond, with conditions: 
--no possession or consumption of controlled substances or drug paraphernalia without a valid prescription 
--no discussion of the case with co-actor [Ryan Ells]
--to report to the Jefferson County Sheriff's Department for booking today.

recess: 2:56pm


NEXT:  (1) Pretrial Conference on 5/4/16 at 10:00am   (2)  Status Conference on 6/21/16 at 10:30am
